transportAdvice: Vail Village and Lionshead are largely pedestrian-friendly, with a free town bus system connecting key areas of the resort and surrounding neighborhoods; taxis and hotel shuttles are available for longer trips, and a regional bus service connects Vail to nearby towns and the Denver area.

weather.description: Peak ski season with cold temperatures and frequent snowfall, ideal for winter sports enthusiasts.
Continued excellent ski conditions with cold, snowy weather and some of the best powder of the season.
Late ski season brings slightly warmer days but still reliable snow, with longer daylight hours.
Spring skiing is possible early in the month, transitioning to muddy shoulder season conditions by late April.
Shoulder season with mild temperatures, melting snow, and many businesses closed between winter and summer operations.
Summer begins with warm days, blooming wildflowers, and afternoon thunderstorms becoming more frequent.
Warm and sunny mornings give way to regular afternoon thunderstorms, making early-day outdoor activities advisable.
Similar to July with warm temperatures and frequent afternoon thunderstorms; hiking and mountain biking are popular.
Autumn brings cooler temperatures, stunning fall foliage, and fewer crowds, making it a pleasant time to visit.
Crisp autumn weather with early snowfall possible at higher elevations and most summer activities winding down.
Early snowfall builds anticipation for ski season, though the resort typically opens late in the month.
Ski season is in full swing with cold temperatures, regular snowfall, and a festive holiday atmosphere in the village.
